title: 美科技巨頭政治遊說支出再破記錄

replies.msg:
Facebook，亞馬遜和蘋果在2019年的遊說支出達到了創紀錄的水平。

The spending — which already was on a record pace for some companies after last year’s third quarter — has come as Big Tech increasingly finds itself in lawmakers and regulators’ cross hairs.

A raft of bills aimed at technology companies were introduced in Congress in 2019, addressing privacy, censorship, security, algorithms, children’s issues, facial recognition and other matters. But Capital Alpha Partners analysts have said the “existence of so many disparate critiques complicates making progress on any one issue.”

In addition, the Trump administration’s Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission have launched antitrust investigations into Big Tech.

An Amazon spokeswoman on Wednesday said the e-commerce titan is “always looking for ways to innovate” for customers, and its Washington, D.C., team is “focused on ensuring we are advocating on issues that are important to our customers, our employees and policy makers.” A Facebook spokesman declined to comment, while Apple, Netflix and Google didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.



去年第三季度之後，這些科技公司的遊說記錄支出紛紛突破記錄。這筆支出隨著這些公司越來越頻繁出現在在立法者和監管機構之間而增多。針對科技公司的一系列法案於2019年在國會提出，涉及隱私，審查制度，安全性，算法，兒童問題，面部識別等問題。此外，特朗普政府的司法部和聯邦貿易委員會已對大科技展開反托拉斯調查。

亞馬遜的一位發言人周三表示，他們「一直在尋找為客戶提供創新的方式」，其華盛頓特區的團隊「致力於確保我們關注提倡的問題對客戶和員工至關重要」。 Facebook發言人拒絕置評，而蘋果，Netflix和谷歌沒有立即回應置評請求。
